title: Property Photo Upload Guide

requiredShots.name: Front Exterior
requiredShots.instructions: Stand across the street, capture entire front including roofline

requiredShots.name: Left Side
requiredShots.instructions: Stand at property boundary, capture full side elevation

requiredShots.name: Right Side
requiredShots.instructions: Stand at property boundary, capture full side elevation

requiredShots.name: Rear Exterior
requiredShots.instructions: From backyard, capture entire rear facade

requiredShots.name: Roof Overview
requiredShots.instructions: From upstairs window or drone if possible

requiredShots.name: Driveway & Entry
requiredShots.instructions: Capture driveway, path, and front entry

interiorShots.name: Entry Hall
interiorShots.instructions: From doorway, capture full view of entry space

interiorShots.name: Living Room
interiorShots.instructions: From each corner, capture all walls and features

interiorShots.name: Kitchen
interiorShots.instructions: Capture all cabinets, appliances, and layout

interiorShots.name: Kitchen Panorama
interiorShots.instructions: Stand in center, rotate and capture all angles

interiorShots.name: Main Bathroom
interiorShots.instructions: Capture all fixtures, tiles, and layout

interiorShots.name: Hallway
interiorShots.instructions: Capture length and connections to rooms

bestPractices: Include reference points (doors, windows) in multiple shots
Take multiple shots of each area from different angles
Use highest resolution setting on your camera
for3DReconstruction: Minimum 30 photos per room for interior
Include floor, walls, and ceiling in shots
Walk around the property in a systematic pattern
Take photos at consistent height (chest level)
